010package imagingbook.pub.color.image;
011
012import static imagingbook.pub.color.image.Illuminant.D65;
013
014import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
015
016
017/**
018 * This class implements the CIELuv color space.
019 * Conversion from/to sRGB is implemented directly through D65-based XYZ
020 * coordinates, i.e., without chromatic adaptation to Java's D50-based profile 
021 * connection space. The methods fromCIEXYZ/toCIEXYZ still return D50-based XYZ 
022 * coordinates in Java's profile connection space.
023 * 
024 * @author W. Burger
025 * @version 2022/01/28
026 */
027@SuppressWarnings("serial")
028public class LuvColorSpace extends ColorSpace {
029                
030        // D65 reference white point:
031        private static final double Xref = D65.getX();  // 0.950456
032        private static final double Yref = D65.getY();  // 1.000000
033        private static final double Zref = D65.getZ();  // 1.088754
034        
035        private static final double uuref = fu(Xref, Yref, Zref); // u'_n
036        private static final double vvref = fv(Xref, Yref, Zref); // v'_n
037        
038        // chromatic adaptation objects:
039        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD65toD50 = new BradfordAdaptation(Illuminant.D65, Illuminant.D50);
040        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD50toD65 = new BradfordAdaptation(Illuminant.D50, Illuminant.D65);
041        
042        public LuvColorSpace() {
043                super(TYPE_Lab,3);
044        }
045        
046        // XYZ50->CIELuv: returns Luv values from XYZ (relative to D50)
047        @Override
048        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] XYZ50) {      
049                float[] XYZ65 = catD50toD65.applyTo(XYZ50);
050                return fromCIEXYZ65(XYZ65);
051        }
052        
053        // XYZ65->CIELuv: returns Luv values from XYZ (relative to D65)
054        private float[] fromCIEXYZ65(float[] XYZ65) {   
055                double X = XYZ65[0];
056                double Y = XYZ65[1];    
057                double Z = XYZ65[2];
058                double YY = f1(Y / Yref);       // Y'
059                double uu = fu(X,Y,Z);          // u'
060                double vv = fv(X,Y,Z);          // v'
061                float L = (float)(116.0 * YY - 16.0);           //L*
062                float u = (float)(13 * L * (uu - uuref));       //u*
063                float v = (float)(13 * L * (vv - vvref));       //v*
064                return new float[] {L, u, v};
065        }
066        
067        // CIELab->XYZ50: returns XYZ values (relative to D50) from Luv
068        @Override
069        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] Luv) {
070                float[] XYZ65 = toCIEXYZ65(Luv);
071                return catD65toD50.applyTo(XYZ65);
072        }
073        
074        private float[] toCIEXYZ65(float[] Luv) {
075                double L = Luv[0];
076                double u = Luv[1];
077                double v = Luv[2];
078                float Y = (float) (Yref * f2((L + 16) / 116.0));
079                double uu = (L<0.00001) ? uuref : u / (13 * L) + uuref; // u'
080                double vv = (L<0.00001) ? vvref : v / (13 * L) + vvref; // v'
081                float X = (float) (Y * ((9*uu)/(4*vv)));
082                float Z = (float) (Y * ((12 - 3 * uu - 20 * vv) / (4 * vv)));
083                float[] XYZ65 = new float[] {X, Y, Z};
084                return XYZ65;
085        }
086        
087        //sRGB->CIELuv
088        @Override
089        public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
090                // get linear rgb components:
091                double r = sRgbUtil.gammaInv(srgb[0]);
092                double g = sRgbUtil.gammaInv(srgb[1]);
093                double b = sRgbUtil.gammaInv(srgb[2]);
094                
095                // convert to XYZ (Poynton / ITU 709) 
096                float X = (float) (0.412453 * r + 0.357580 * g + 0.180423 * b);
097                float Y = (float) (0.212671 * r + 0.715160 * g + 0.072169 * b);
098                float Z = (float) (0.019334 * r + 0.119193 * g + 0.950227 * b);
099                
100                float[] XYZ65 = new float[] {X, Y, Z}; 
101                return fromCIEXYZ65(XYZ65);
102        }
103        
104        //CIELuv->sRGB
105        @Override
106        public float[] toRGB(float[] Luv) {
107                float[] XYZ65 = toCIEXYZ65(Luv);
108                double X = XYZ65[0];
109                double Y = XYZ65[1];
110                double Z = XYZ65[2];
111                // XYZ -> RGB (linear components)
112                double r = ( 3.240479 * X + -1.537150 * Y + -0.498535 * Z);
113                double g = (-0.969256 * X +  1.875992 * Y +  0.041556 * Z);
114                double b =  (0.055648 * X + -0.204043 * Y +  1.057311 * Z);
115
116//              if (RgbGamutChecker.checkOutOfGamut(r, g, b) && RgbGamutChecker.markOutOfGamutColors) { // REMOVE ************************** !! 
117//                      r = RgbGamutChecker.oGred; 
118//                      g = RgbGamutChecker.oGgrn; 
119//                      b = RgbGamutChecker.oGblu;
120//              }
121                
122                // RGB -> sRGB (nonlinear components)
123                float rr = (float) sRgbUtil.gammaFwd(r);
124                float gg = (float) sRgbUtil.gammaFwd(g);
125                float bb = (float) sRgbUtil.gammaFwd(b);                        
126                return new float[] {rr,gg,bb} ; //sRGBcs.fromCIEXYZ(XYZ50);
127        }
128        
129        //---------------------------------------------------------------------
130        
131        private static final double epsilon = 216.0/24389;
132        private static final double kappa = 841.0/108;
133        
134        // Gamma correction for L* (forward)
135        private double f1 (double c) {
136                if (c > epsilon) // 0.008856
137                        return Math.cbrt(c);
138                else
139                        return (kappa * c) + (16.0 / 116);
140        }
141        
142        // Gamma correction for L* (inverse)
143        private double f2 (double c) {
144                double c3 = c * c * c; //Math.pow(c, 3.0);
145                if (c3 > epsilon)
146                        return c3;
147                else
148                        return (c - 16.0 / 116) / kappa;
149        }
150        
151        private static double fu (double X, double Y, double Z) { // X,Y,Z must be positive
152                if (X < 0.00001)        // fails if 0.001 is used!
153                        return 0;
154                else
155                        return (4 * X) / (X + 15 * Y + 3 * Z);
156        }
157        
158        private static double fv (double X, double Y, double Z) { // X,Y,Z must be positive
159                if (Y < 0.00001)
160                        return 0;
161                else
162                        return (9 * Y) / (X + 15 * Y + 3 * Z);
163        }
164        
165        //---------------------------------------------------------------------
166        
167        // moved to tests:
168

170//      int sr = 128;
171//      int sg = 1;
172//      int sb = 128;
173//      System.out.format("Input (sRGB) = %d, %d, %d\n", sr, sg, sb);
174//      System.out.format("XYZref = %f, %f, %f\n", Xref, Yref, Zref);
175//      
176//      LuvColorSpace cs = new LuvColorSpace();
177//      //float[] luv = cs.fromCIEXYZ(new float[] {.1f,.5f,.9f});
178//      float[] luv = cs.fromRGB(new float[] {sr/255f, sg/255f, sb/255f});
179//
180//      System.out.format("Luv = %.2f, %.2f, %.2f\n", luv[0],luv[2],luv[2]);
181//      //float[] xyz = cs.toCIEXYZ(luv);
182//      float[] srgb = cs.toRGB(luv);
183//      System.out.format("sRGB = %.2f, %.2f, %.2f\n", 
184//                      Math.rint(255*srgb[0]), Math.rint(255*srgb[1]), Math.rint(255*srgb[2]));
185//      
186//    }
187
188}
